ClfTr5vDDFPVzXv1OisH1g.review_text: Came here with 3 friends on a Saturday night. Loved the look of the place when I walked in. We hadn't eaten dinner, so we each ordered a "sharing" plate as our entree, as well as a few smaller dishes as appetizers. They were sold out of brussel sprouts.   GOOD 1) DECOR: Retro/hipster vibe.  BAD (everything else) 1) AMBIANCE: Terrible acoustics and an awkwardly large 4-person table made it impossible to hear the person sitting across the table.  2) PORTIONS: Besides the poutine and the mac n cheese, the plates were not actually sharable. My husband could have eaten both the lobster empanadas and the pork belly by himself, in 2 bites each. Instead, to make the food last longer, we cut it into a million pieces. Yes, we could have ordered more, but see the next bullet.      3) PRICE: $18 for lobster empanadas, $16 for the pork belly, $12 for poutine (aka - fancy french fries).    4) FOOD:  * Lobster Empanadas: No flavor. Or perhaps there wasn't enough empanada for me to taste the flavor. Who knows?  * Pork Belly: Fine, but nothing special.  * Poutine: The "cheese curds" were like chopped chunks of supermarket cheese, and not a particularly tasty one at that.    5) SERVICE: Waitress took our food away without asking whether we were done. (I wasn't!)  Despite a hefty tab, we all left hungry, and I left vowing never to return.

4ayHp_rg2FVKpcl5FuTSWw.review_text: Atmosphere: small intimate, with lots of seating at the bar or on the couch.  Prices: great during happy hour, $6 beer & $7 wine  Crowds: mixture of tourists and local  Hayes Valley is one of my fave parts in the city so of course I couldn't pass up a chance for happy hour here.  The lounge has a small intimate feeling which is great for conversations.  Our server was friendly and attentive but not overly annoying. Overall, great spot to come and unwind after a long work week!

8b9GJsvhIfbyLRyFTbIUqQ.review_text: Not what I was expecting - in a good way!  Film noir theme, but more old-timey and less gothy.  Great HH.

wA0LB_5VK1vCeanEp_xfNg.review_text: Hi, I live so close but not a fan of them. Walked in to have a glass and then was ignored for so long I left.  Granted, I was not dressed to impress but I was just stopping in for happy hour which they proudly boast outside. I don't need their snobbishness for a glass of good wine. There are plenty of other places to satisfy my craving. Feel sorry for them because they won't be getting my business (and again, I live 2 blocks away and love wine:) )  Plus, they often close the whole place for private parties so you can't rely on them to be open to the public. Blah!

RCKdmKDZRd-RovZVtNSCLA.review_text: Was very cool seeing a B&W projection of "The 39 Steps" in the Film Lounge in back of this place tonight! Having a glass of Vouvrait bubble from France while discussing various topics with my other half was both refreshing and relaxing. Heard Coldplay in the background as our order of prosciutto and melons arrived.  Did see a piano in here -- would be lovely to hear it played. If young people shouting nearby would not be using the F-word so often tonight, I would be in heaven!

yxP4e2OmDG0B-m0DKRgQeA.review_text: I love the ambiance, however, they will never close the doors so it is freezing inside.  All the patrons are in coats and scarves.  When I asked to close the door, one of the workers was super rude and wouldn't allow me to close it.  The bartender was nice though and switched the doors for me.  Cool bar, literally.

hLZhIcq9qupYTeW5FHInEA.review_text: I'm probably a lot luckier than premiere Cherylynn N., when it came to checking this place out. *cue Pharrell's Get Lucky song* Sure the spot represents the swanky digs of the Hayes Valley community. Think Piedmont with a little more hipster thrown around I guess? Anyway, the lady wanted some wine and it just so happens the Yelp app suggested this was the only place open on a Saturday at 4pm (most places opened around 5pm). Sitting down at the Bar we meet Chase, the guy that probably keeps all the H.V. ladies on their toes. A very personable guy who's coasting through life as a bartender in the industry. When I asked fellow waitresses their impression of him, a blush or two seems to be the response. He admitted right off the back recently they acquired some new wines and in order for him to get back to his rhythm, he needed to sample a few before pouring our orders. Our initial pours of wine were of the following: (instagram.com/p/hE3Op4Hh…) Pinot Noir, Laurier Carneros 2009 and Chardonnay, Jeriko Estate, Russian River Personally, I found the Pinot to be a bit too mellow for me. Whereas the Chardonnay had some nice buttery notes which would have complimented the Lobster Empanadas I hope to try in the near future. One by one, he kept uncorking and tasting some of the stuff. During his personal tasting, he allowed Jasmine and I to sample some of the Mediterranean stuff and get our personal view of things. After those samples we wanted some munchies so we also ended up ordering some Brisket Poutine: (instagram.com/p/hFA-sjnh…) Now it's a bit unfair comparing this Brisket to my friend (and fellow Yelper) Dru C., who makes a real serious Brisket. The dish as a whole was nice, I get the purpose of the Petaluma cheese curds, hints of garlic, the fries and the gravy kind of all layer on top of one another without stealing the spotlight for too long. My only qualm with the dish is the gravy sort of gave the brisket a backseat. When I think of well done brisket, I believe you should taste the moistness of the BBQ within the inner layers of the meat while enjoying a refined touch of smokiness. I also believe this dish could also be elevated if there were an addition of burnt ends (I know its more of a Kansas thing). Anyway Chase and the rest of the crew made us feel apart of the Hayes neighborhood even though we were a bridge away. I look forward to going back and exploring more of the savory treats and wine in the future. Four stars for an initial rating, cheers!

PNVDZhitq6ardTHPIlyUiA.review_text: Great place, great selection of wines but horrible service. The staff are rude and incompetent. The server didn't even take our order. We tried to call her but she didn't give a shit. She was texting all the time. The host had to come and take our order, which he messed up. He told us he would comp on of the three wines, but when the check arrived, nothing was comped. It's a pity because it is a wonderful place with great potential.

XrRbDfhofoq-Cys6oKXdJw.review_text: Favorite new spot in Hayes... it just might be!  An abundant selection of wine, service always friendly and attentive. I love that they have internet - what's a better way to get work done than with a nice bottle of red on the side.   Self serve popcorn. Great tots (when I went they had gouda tots! so delightful)  The space is large with many seating options, at the bar, big comfy chairs, tables, and a large communal table where you are bound to meet new friends.   I pretty sure I'm on my way to becoming a regular :) Cheers!

qVCGzJCDnjwut1dnHef2Og.review_text: Stopped in here just a few minutes too late - they have an early license soon to be upgraded for later service but this evening they were forced to close at 10pm. Enjoyed a couple glasses of wine from a bright young lady named Katie - she was cool and their wine list is excellent!   Great variety and well priced - they have wines from $8 on up - I had a Lirac (think Chateauneuf du Pape Rhone styled Red with a blend of Grenache, Syrah, and Mourvedre). Absolutely delicious and my friend had a good HOPPY beer.   Looking forward to eating there next time I'm in the city - also met the owners, both fun entertaining couple with plenty to contribute to conversation.

F6hOzZYpj5gi00Bs7eJdxw.review_text: I really dig this place! It's got a good rustic vibe to it. I went here last night for Microhood and people said the bar was more busy than usual. Fortunately my friends and I were able to snag the couch by the front entrance.   Very good beer selection, I had the Pilsner. And the tater tots, holy moly so good!

x4omxqHAFoVe2thnV-wANw.review_text: Great place to get a glass of wine.  Make sure to have the white bordeaux, if you like crisp white wines.  The whole ambiance is unique and super.  Somehow putting a flat screen inside a painting frame and showing old films work for me.  Call me crazy.  :)

GfB6sC4NJQvSI2ewbQrDNA.review_text: I went here on a date last week on a Friday night.  The ambiance is a little strange.  I really wanted to like this place since it's situated perfectly in Hayes Valley and I came here on a non-crowded night and it's awesome.  As soon as it gets packed it kills the ambiance.  The waitress was running around, but she was really nice, she just didn't know what she was doing.  She kept asking how everything was, but our wine glasses were full.  Also, you can see that in the back they skipped some corners to save money.  You can see through the ceiling in the back, some of the furniture up front doesn't seem to match and the table we were sitting at was too tall.  Also, the back room seemed really cool, but of course since it's San Francisco it was full.  I can't wait for the day when you can make reservations at bars in this city as well, it's sorely needed.  The crowd wasn't Noir at all, it kind of reminded me of hanging out in the Marina and it was really loud.  I want to come back when it's mellow to check it out again.

vLqbQkcSkvbWJRB96UTAsA.review_text: Service is not good. The male waiter seems upset and walks away... There was a newbie who seemed to try to be nice but I realized she overcharged me. There was no music or playlist... Just a piano which can be nice at 5 pm but not at 11. Overall given the overcharge on my open tab (how that happens when I'm sitting at the bar is beyond me) I'm not keen on going back.

d0xsgwc-7H5GyIPXiUBnDQ.review_text: Really cute old-fashioned looking lounge. Several rooms, each with cozy chairs and tables and a piano playing later in the night. The food was decent. Great place to grab drinks with friends.

9kSGEaVW0KCNNEVn9JzOgg.review_text: My favorite spot in Hayes Valley whenever I'm visiting the City. The decor is beautiful and the wine selection is thoughtful (and impressive). A nice place to start the evening or stop in after a show. Service has always been good, which is hard for a newly opened place. Overall, a very unique and quality find.

wx5tAWoTb02kM-hG5Aer9A.review_text: We came here on a Saturday just an hour after they had open, so the atmosphere was sleepy with just 2 other guest. The lighting is soft and decore fits the name. Perfect date spot for those who wants some good beverages without having to yell over their environment. Friendly knowledgeable bartender, I will be coming back!

pqyokIQMWTudCnDBzVbN8Q.review_text: I really liked this place. It's classy and the ambiance and decor are great, as are the drinks and appetizers. Great piano playing too.

1HKoA-39R3HgoGuk0nEfWg.review_text: Nice vibe, comfy chairs, decent list of beer and wine choices. I enjoyed my time there!

r3UmPWmn_e62xJpEngrAxg.review_text: Slow Service...sit at the bar for better faster service.  Stood around for 5 minutes until a person/server told us it was first come first serve everywhere.   There was no cashier/bartender there when I walked in I could have literally robbed the place..... When she did show up she just stared at me...I should have read her mind and sat myself down Duh!! -_-  Hmm...they changed chefs so the food seen on yelp photos are different now. One of the servers told me since I asked why the chicken waffles were smaller/different. Food is a bit overpriced but is not horrible...but could get way better food and cheaper just down the street :(.... But still yummy! Would probably come back just because of the wine selection and intimate setting...but not dying to revisit!

Xq6sM8dg9-y-k2siiTcuWA.review_text: Blind Tiger Tap Bar, where's my service?

bRHY80OHhmobT_GdnTAU-g.review_text: Very unique setting and lots of options for seating - want comfy chairs or a communal bar table or table for 4? They've got you covered. Cocktails are solid, but I was more impressed by the food. We ordered the fried chicken that came with broccoli florets (odd pairing) but the sauce...the sauce! A spicy maple concoction that paired very well with the friend chicken filets. Lamb sliders were also extremely delicious. Their flat bread was essentially a small round pizza that was kinda lack luster. Everything else was perfect!

NxxmeuEYqOp6459O6WmauQ.review_text: They totally deserved this rating as a full team from staff to bartender to owner.  They are a horrible establishment. I live in the neighborhood and I travel globally the service here ranks in the bottom 10% of the world including some 3rd world countries.  Don't let the decor fool you. Just because it looks cool shouldn't obligate you to bear with the low quality service.  I ordered sliders. I bought the beer from the bar. They said they would deliver it to the table. Essentially 6 feet away. I patiently and politely waited for half an hour. Nothing happened. I asked the two waitresses if I woukd get anything served soon. They ignored me. Then I asked again seriously I ordered food .. sliders.. is it coming? The waitress said you already ate it and you are asking for more? Your flickering eyes see not telling me the truth. And left.  Yeah I realized from a recent interview I was flickering my eyes too much but not much I can do about the fact that I spend too much time in front of the computer to earn a living. I realized she didnt symphatize with my foodlessness I approached the bartender woman again asking where my food is. She said it was delivered but that she can order it again if I want.... I said considering I never got it it would be inappropriate to say "again". she said to come back in 5 minutes to the bar.I waited 15 minutes went back nothing was there. She was totally annoyed that I came back. I said is it coming? She said in a few minutes. Gave them another 10 minutes went back again.. nothing. In the meantime their low class waitresses were serving some other people's dishes and when I looked their way wondering if that was my food, they reprimanded me saying not to touch that since it wasn't my food as if I was gonna steal the shitty food on the plate when I was just wondering where this oh-so-wonderful food was that I had been waiting for 1 hour.  I went back to the bar she got even more pissed dove into the kitchen and came out with two shitty looking biscuits on a plate. Tripped a bit. I said can I please have some water with that. She unwillingly went to the faucet grabbing a wine glass (they don't knkw how to serve water) and she filled it up with some shit colored tap water with no ice and handed the wine glass to me. I told her this is not potable water and refused the glass.  Went to the table to try the delicacy. Some clown showed up alerted about the situation. Asking if all was ok. Obviously it wasnt. I took a bite of the horrendous piece of shit slider and tried to eat a bit more. It was so spicy snd bad. It's the kind of food thst gives you heartburn afterwards. Unflavorful and overly spicy. I was so hungry I teied to finish 1 and left the second one. The owner came and asked if all was good I told him he should consult his staff. He is arrogant and obviously doesnt come from the service industry. I told him he might as wel shut down the place right away since its so bad. He didn't even know how to apoligize.. he left.. and 20 minutes passed as if he had practiced in front of the mirror finally came back and apologized posthumously in a very insincere manner. I told him whatever and he disappeared and reappeared agaib at 10 to take away a friend's leftover beer blaming the city about the liquor license policies without eveb allowing him to finish his beer. We left to place pigalle to never go back to the shittiest service I have ever seen in my life.  Avoid this piece or shit.the name noir means black in french, they should rename themselves as merde.

TLdtuZm6Ms0V22I6htXBaQ.review_text: What a cute place, and bigger than we expected!  + Plenty of seating- couches, chairs, tables, coffee tables + Old black and white movies projected on the walls + Friendly service, knowledgeable staff + Not packed on a Sunday afternoon + Cute decor + Good music  - Food was lacking, but at least wine selection was good

BByY6TRXOpV99wJdMzNgfQ.review_text: I went here a couple weeks ago with a friend and everything was great. It is surprisingly large on the inside and there is live music. It does tend to get a little loud. The food was really good but the service was slightly slow. Overall the experience there was great. So why 3 stars? A few days later I checked my bank statement and they overcharged me. By almost $20! And I called and left a message and no one called me back. I called again and talked to someone and she promised she would get it taken care of and would call me back because "something weird happened." But I never heard back from her...I am going to continue to call but am not holding my breath. So go and enjoy your time, just make sure you keep your receipt and that they don't try to charge you more than your bill!

_N--zSeYplWJyh-VHFWXdg.review_text: Went there for brunch on a Saturday, arrived shortly after opening. Staff was super friendly and attentive. I had the Breakfast Sammy, my girlfriend had the Mushroom Crepe - both were very impressive and reasonably priced. Ambience is great - will be going back for an evening experience.

ILz8ApVEgTqbv5LnC6PyuA.review_text: Great spot for wine and beer, but they also have really good small plates of food. Been here a couple times now and the second time was after they added the bar in the back room. It's a nice idea in theory, but that area seems cramped and noisy now (especially if you are sitting at said back bar).

W-LMhcHsMwb8O3d2KRiW0Q.review_text: One of my favorite spots to get a glass of wine in Hayes valley. Great small plates and fun vibe - haven't had a bad drink here yet!

fq5ChXmD-G4we1iIzrWC4A.review_text: Thank you so much to Brian the owner and the wait staff at Noir Lounge / Lunchpad for your hospitality today. We held my BFFs graduation lunch there in their back room. We started planning two weeks ago and everyone was so hospitable, easy to work with, & generous with us. They stayed open late, gave us extra waitstaff, made us a fresh pot of coffee (after they had already closed!) and all around, Noir & Lunchpad went ABOVE and BEYOND to make us feel welcome. Thank you again.

MGxuBuCMXUvHR2u39TNRdQ.review_text: The decor is well done, but for a lounge the place is too loud. Seems to be more of a wine bar with a small (very small) bar menu anyway, rather than a lounge.  Went there on a Saturday night.. hungry.. The menu was small to begin with. The only substantial items they had were meatballs and Risotto.. Everything else was salad, cheese plate etc. That in itself is not bad, however, we ordered Risotto and a salad, knowing already, that the meat balls were out..  Very late.. like a second before the non substantial salad arrived, they told us they were out of the Risotto, too, which left no more substantial food item on the menu to fill my belly..!   I'm very sorry, but a puppy eyed "Sorry" doesn't cut it. For such a screw up the waitress should have offered to bring any of the other non substantial food items for free, as I told her I was very hungry and had asked about other filling options..  Nothing like that, the bill came, all items on there, full price. That's not how you treat a sophisticated customer, but maybe that's not what they are looking for..?

oScR9Re-VqvqXAEKWf7Lxg.review_text: The service at this place sucks. We waited for 15 minutes until someone brought us a menu. Then, the waitress brought us the wrong beer. When we asked for the check, the waitress told us she lost my boyfriend's credit card. Eventually they found it in the trash. They didn't even apologize. We asked to speak to the manger who did not apologize, but insisted she was "good at her job." This place is not worth all the hype. Don't waste your time or money here.

knReN1F-2WbpQzyhElvnYQ.review_text: TL;DR - Service was poor, food wasn't memorable, and being served right before they were going to kick us out (which we didn't know) was the breaking point.  Stopped by Noir for an evening/late snack and some wine with a friend.  The place is beautiful, the chairs are comfortable, and it has an overall nice vibe.  But I didn't come to the place to soak in the atmosphere.  The service, like so many other people have mentioned was not on point, not even really close.  We received our snack order before we received our wine, even though we'd ordered our wine first.  We ordered the blue cheese bites, deviled eggs, beet salad, and the johnny cakes.  (Okay, so a big snack.)  Blue cheese bites were underwhelming, the deviled eggs were good because of the siracha in them, beet salad was okay and the johnny cakes were tasteless and we didn't even finish them.  At 9:30pm we were asked if we'd like more wine, which yes we did.  After a long while we received our wine, and our check and were informed that we needed to be done and out of the restaurant by 10pm.  So after shot-gunning our wine we left.

CDtbuyJBYyDT21lJMod6OA.review_text: Don't order food here its a rip off!!!  Drinks and mood are OK... but food is not worth the money...  We were out bar hopping, and this bar was my turn to pick up the tab... we were all getting snack-attacks, so we ordered the tater tots and the mini sandwiches... for $8 there were like... 5 taters in a teeny tiny bowl, and the sandwiches were thick bread with too much crust and the thinest layer of cheese you have ever seen, it was SAD!  It had tiny grapes CUT IN HALF and limp little pathetic greens all around it...  It was the low point of our night.  Thankfully.

zFuYISK9K9poVrS5rkNSAw.review_text: Perfect ambiance, great wines, delicious food, and wonderful service!

f-20PoobIoFSbqLtRcjPcw.review_text: This place screams "date spot".  My friends and I cozied up on the couches in the back section right in front of the movie screen.  Each person walked in and had an "I love it in here! This place is so cool!" reaction to the ambiance.  The decor is sophisticated but comfortable, lounge-y with a little glam.  I didn't have any of the dinner food, but we split a bunch of apps - all were tasty.  Took advantage of the Happy Hour specials while they lasted, which is always appreciated.  Impressively packed for a Tuesday night, and because of that I did feel like our service was a little spotty.  Everyone was super nice... but we had a few things get lost in translation -- either not come out as we ordered or not come out at all.  Overall I think we had at least 4 different people helping us so it was bound to happen.  They were clearly aiming to please but couldn't quite handle the crowd.  I think this place has a lot of potential.  I'll be going back for sure!

lFkaYOQn5HnkU-oFyccboQ.review_text: I like the place but had a bad experience last night. We ordered two drinks which came to about $20 and asked to split the check between two credit cards. The waiter brought back a bill of ~$20 on *each* of our cards. We asked them to correct this and they appeared to, but today I see in my bank history that they put though 2 more charges on *each* of our cards that added up to the same amount. I'm not sure how this could happen unintentionally.

zVo-J1QMEcaHfY0zBpN1mg.review_text: thank you noir lounge. Great wine bar with a great selection.

44QJFy-EUL18Z5xcwPP6pQ.review_text: Nice place, good service, but i'm only giving it a 3 star since they charge $6 for a beer at happy hour. Why even have a happy hour?

eH034FAZ5xfMFl21yKnhcA.review_text: After the misuse of the space that was Frjtz, they've transformed the space into a kind of a vintage speakeasy/lounge.  If you remember the old space, it goes back much further than some of the other storefronts, so it's much bigger than it looks from the outside.  It opens kind of early for a bar/lounge, but kind of late for a cafe.  But, if you're drinking beer, you probably shouldn't be doing that before then anyway.  Staff is helpful, and attentive.  Too early for me to pass any judgement on the food, but the wine/beer selection is pretty good.  Not massive, but "good enough".  Meaning, I think they have a good variety, but not too many selections that they end up with bottles or kegs sitting in the cellar for years.

Obc-VP99cOlLa0Z0tG_BPQ.review_text: Went here to catch up with a friend on a week night after work, and it was such a nice place to unwind.  They have lots of options for seating: bar, communal table, cozy couch, tables for 2 or 4, etc.  The place was pleasantly full but not packed--perfect for people-watching, but no anxiety about having to balance a drink while staying out of the way of the servers (as with so many bars in SF).  The lighting wasn't too low, the music not too loud--again, very relaxing, and perfect for conversation.  The food is GREAT, especially if you like cheese: we had the johnnycakes, bleu cheese mini-grilled-cheese sandwiches, veggie chili, and smoked gouda tater tots (get these! delicious!! they reminded me of Spanish croquetas).  But be forewarned that the portions are a little small--more bar bites than dinner.  I'll leave the wine critiques to someone else, but the servers were great with suggestions, and we both wound up drinking a second glass.  Cheers!

PhheVnonXFv6SVGmAiipuw.review_text: Drinks were good, just had one red wine that was a little "tasteless". Other than that we ordered some olives, figs and sliders - all of which were delicious! Also the staff was fine, attentative and friendly.

Eypq5gLLjCapBVVnMw_MyA.review_text: Besides the noir movies playing in the background, there isn't anything particularly noir-ish about this place. But really, I'm not sure what that would even mean. Femme fatale waitresses poisoning your drinks? Maltese falcons everywhere?  On the plus side, they have fine drinks and pretty decent, if not a bit expensive food. We had the mac and cheese, tater tots, and brussels sprouts. They do a good job of serving stuff that's easy to share.

3JbWovIQS68rkOhGRaI6yg.review_text: Go. Just Go. It's one of the most amazing experiences you could ever have in this city. The food, the drinks, THE SERVICE all wonderful. These people have thoughtfully created an atmosphere that is comfortable, welcoming, and incredibly sexy.

yGcRDtBOpCYnEFooKOPUOA.review_text: I don't understand the rave reviews about this place. Yes, the food is good and the service was thoughtful but that's all I can say. Do people actually think this mesh-mash of three or four smelly (really smelly), small rooms is elegant? If this is the best SF has to offer, I'd hate to see the worst. And then there is the piano at blast-off volume! The only excuse for thinking this place is designed elegantly or even uniquely is if you have never been anywhere truly elegant in New York, Paris or London. Sad.

eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg.review_text: UH-AMAZING Concept. UH-AMAZING Ambiance. UN-AMAZING Service. Working nearby, I was excited to learn that a new wine bar would be opening in Hayes Valley at the old Fritz location. Uniquely San Francisco, Noir Lounge is an ultra-sexy wine bar with a 1940s vintage theme, sultry reds and golds, and plushy sofas and chairs. A total HOT DATE spot. What makes this an amazing lounge is its film noir theme. There's a huge ceiling to floor projection TV in the den area (there's also multiple flat screens around the lounge) that is set to play black and white movies. I adored the awesome shadow box of two silhouetted figures from The Big Combo (1955): bit.ly/16syBHo. If Foreign Cinema had a lounge this would be it.   After dinner last night, I decided to drag the bf to Noir Lounge for a night cap (soft opened on 3/29). We arrived at 6:45 pm (yes, we eat like old farts) and was easily able to find a table in the back area. There's a front bar area with lounge chairs and a communal table, a back bar area with more sit-down tables, and then the den area which houses the whole projection screen TV (come early and snag seats here!). The cute menu was presented as a play bill: bit.ly/16z9Afy and featured about 10 wine by the glasses at $8-$14/glass and several pages of wines by the bottle at $31-$68/bottle. They also have a good selection of beers for $5-$7/glass. While I understand that it's a wine bar and not everyone is a lush like me, it would be nice to see non-alcoholic drink(s) on the menu (every wine bar that I've been to does). There's a lot of people who can't drink wine or beer because of religious reasons, health reasons and/or maybe they're in AA. They may just be out to mingle and socialize with their friends so non-alcoholic option(s) should be available to them other than tap water. Noir currently has a bar bite/snack menu from pop-up chef of Sweet Jo's Chili & Biscuits with very enticing items like Smoked Gouda Tater Tots ($6), Ham & Biscuit Sliders w/ Pulled Pork ($8) and Rock Shrimp Johnnycakes ($12). The menu: bit.ly/YykAIj. Now onto the UN-AMAZING part of the review... While they're still in a soft opening mode and still trying to figure things out, there were A LOT of major service issues that I couldn't overlook. I was teetering back and forth of whether to write this review but I think it would be beneficial to the owner(s) so they can iron our these major kinks before their grand opening. (1) My drink took an excessively long time to arrive. We sat there as four of the surrounding tables received their drinks before us. Mind you, they arrived and ordered AFTER we had. It took 25 minutes to get my glass of wine: bit.ly/XSf57R. **Note about the wine markup, my glass of wine was $14/glass but online, a bottle retails for $16.99!?!?! That's cray! (2) The staff was confused, overwhelmed and clearly lacked training. **While I was ordering a glass of the blend, I asked the waitress what was the correct pronunciation was to which she replied, "I have no idea." I don't expect the staff to remember the menu like the back of their hand but they should have some basic understanding of it. If they don't know, a more appropriate answer would be: "You know what, I'm not 100% sure but let me find out for you." **We watched as wrong food orders were brought out to tables who never ordered to food to begin with. Even the chef came out and asked the back bar area if anyone had ordered sliders because they had been sitting in the kitchen for 15 minutes. Bless her heart but publicly announcing this in front of customers was unnecessary as it drew more attention to their service issues. (3) The owner seemed like a really nice guy as he checked in with some tables several times but never checked in once with others. It's good business practice to be consistent especially IF you want return customers so he should of checked in with all customers and not just selective ones. We were not one of the selected tables. (4) Even though we had just eaten dinner, I was adamant about ordering one thing off the food menu. It's a good thing we decided to eat dinner beforehand because our Smoked Gouda Tater Tots never came; rather it got mistakenly sent to the table in back of us. Our waitress saw this, apologized, and said that our order would be coming. Another 20 minutes passed and we never received it so I asked that she cancel our order. Sorry, we don't have all night to wait. (5) When it came time to pay for our bill, we paid cash and never received our change. When my bf flagged down our waitress to ask for his change, he received our bill (again) but no change. I absolutely love the venue so I'm hoping they work out these kinks out because I do wish them success. Until then, come with a lot of patience and don't forget to nosh on the complimentary popcorn from the vintage popcorn maker.   À la prochaine, Noir Lounge...

KSWPvkvbHHQVspjlssh8IQ.review_text: Visiting San Francisco for the first time and looked up lounges to visit after dinner. We were looking for something fun for the older crowd. This place looked good on Yelp and the reviews were high.  Here's the real deal...the atmosphere is BORING! They just recently received their liquor license so their drink menu is very limited. The bartender is AWFUL! She didn't have the ingredients for an apple martini!! When I asked her to make me a martini ...I'm not sure what she made (tasted like a lemon drop). My boyfriend asked for a vodka, soda with a splash of orange juice and well...she poured the orange juice on ice, added the club soda and then the vodka...WTF??? Needless to say...it tasted awful!  No live music on a Friday??? YAWN!!! I won't be back and don't recommend it to visitors. This is a neighborhood bar...an that only!!!

WVeqSl23V90wHMPkGwyv5Q.review_text: Came here with a few girlfriends after work. I immediately loved the ambiance, from the table seating out front to the more intimate seating in the back room. The window shutters on the ceiling and the chandelier are also a nice, romantic touch. As for wine, we ordered a rose, pinot, chardonnay, and sauvignon blanc. And for food, we had the brussel sprouts with bacon, mac n cheese, bruschetta, and gourmet tots - I loved the gourmet tots and bruschetta! Overall, good wine, pretty good food, and great ambiance.   They seemed a bit understaffed, though, and the place is a bit on the pricey side, but it's great for a small bite. The crowd also seems mostly local and young (20s, 30s). I'll definitely be back if I'm in the neighborhood!

w_xclw8POH9fuVW61XW_jw.review_text: Horrible service. We had to wait 20 minutes for a rude waitress to come and take our oder. We ordered drinks and food. She forget the food! The place is very noisy. Prices are expensive. They sell a 6oz glass of champagne for $19. I work in a bar too, and I'm pretty sure they lie about the quantity. Same for the wine.

c24niAEMJmgne4UflTS_mA.review_text: I love this place.  I love the decor, and the film noir movies that play in the background.  I have been here a few times and have always been very happy.  The people who work there are all really friendly.  The food is great for snack bites, and the bread pudding is to die for.  Good variety of wines, and a few on tap too.    Awesome place to sit and chill with friends, or show some out of town guests a great local place thats different, fun, inviting with great wine.  It's also right by the 21 so you don't have to walk far, only across the street.  I really don't have any complaints.  Defiantly a one of my favorites

WOlfaz4vzUNvNxCScXeYrg.review_text: Great wine bar in Hayes Valley if you're looking to grab a drink in that hood.  The place is super cute inside and feels small but it's actually a decent size.  I would say its a place you want to go with company you know because it is hard to hear people in there.  So if it's a first date probably not the best spot on a weekend.  The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable and they never forgot about us which was nice.  I would definitely go back there and recommend it for people looking for a spot before a show or just cruising Hayes Valley.

dW2uIz60INteoC5w1_k2aQ.review_text: Fun & Chill. As well as unpretentious service. Also native owned.

7XwdplOp2UR3JWRkZQTkiw.review_text: This bar is so nice!! I loved the music they were playing. There were old black and white movies on the tv screens that are up around the lounge. There are a lot of places to sit and hang out and their wine selection is awesome! The service was so great and the place is so clean and easy to find. LOVED IT!!

MHLJxx7M9WJGUVhnU1ogtg.review_text: Came here for before dinner drinks and had a good time.  This wine bar has great ambiance for a date or small group gathering. I had a glass of Pinot noir and my husband had the house Sauvignon, both were good but nothing to rave about. Perhaps we picked the wrong wines or if we stayed longer we may have been able to try more. The bartender was very nice and attentive despite the fact that her friend came and sat next to us at the bar and was chatting her up the whole time.   Would definitely come here again to try more wines, if not just for the ambiance!

EQ-fPVMNGhwZOdB8PJ25ug.review_text: Fancy place with high def TVs and friendly staff. The cool dark ambience reflects a ironic light mood.  Spring time! 4-20

4T2uVlRjkl0eogswfL2bTA.review_text: Nice wine bar! The service was impeccable (granted there were not a lot of customers late Sunday afternoon). The seating is all comfy couches and lounge chairs.   I tried their white wine on tap, tastes like white wine! We also got their tater tots, which were warm and tasty but nothing over the top.  Beer selection is not that great.   They play black and white movies against the wall, which was a fun touch!   Overall, not sure I would go out of my way to go back.

NP1Se0HF38cZoDwgNAASnw.review_text: I love this place! Best wine bar in the city bar none! Please excuse the pun. :) Wow! Lets talk about the decor and ambiance, stellar! Then there is the service, our waitress couldn't have been nicer and more attentive. Her recommendations for the appetizers were paired perfectly with the Prosecco.  Finally the Pièce de résistance "The Food"! Again wow! None of that stuffy grub that "The Other Wine Bars" serve. Do you even know what Poutine is? Ok get your mind out of the gutter...you may not but I'm sure your French Canadian friends do. I will let you do your own research on that. Chicken and Waffles!  Damn! Blew my mind! Mushroom Crepe with an awesome cheese I cannot pronounce with truffle oil!  I'm still licking my fingers! :) Lastly can you have Lastly when following a Pièce de résistance? Anywho, the dessert is and now was incredible! Crème Brûlée crepe cake, a chocolate pudding with fresh & puréed berries. Ok. I'm stuffed now I'm starting to doze off. I don't think I can finish Zzz...

bTFZ-cepM91pdS2PFpvJiA.review_text: Cute wine bar.   Fun decor.   We went Friday around 6 and got a table near the back - guy playing piano.   Nice spot with food options - we had the fry cone - enough for 4-6 people to have a good portion and the tots. Go with the fries.  The local Pinot noir was good and only $7-glass!   Service wasn't bad either. Must have improved since soft opening.  Vs. fig and thistle another wine bar in the area definitely more Intimate and romantic for a date with a lot more seating and food options from apps to small dinner plates.

cuobBbv5wi4wZckIl2mcQQ.review_text: Fabulous atmosphere, great wine, prime location!  The ambiance is seductive and the decor makes it feel like you've stepped back into another (super classy) era.    The screening room in the back is the prime spot.  The space is  filled with super-comfortable vintage-style couches and vintage black and white films are projected onto the screen, which looks like it's right out of old Hollywood, velvet curtains and all.  The wine list is spectacular and the new chef (as of several weeks ago we're told) serves up fabulous food to accompany whatever you're sipping.  Overall a great experience and a fantastic place for a first date or a "let's leave the kids at home" date.  We'll certainly be back to enjoy more of this fabulous vibe... and we also intend to check out their Sunday Brunch!

eTyCSfXXbfCT1nhGe7D2-A.review_text: Cool little gem we found walking around Hayes valley! Great date spot, they play old movies and they have a person playing the piano sometimes. I'll be back for sure!

zosx5Budah5kpwUWtAI1OA.review_text: Stopped by on Monday for a drink at the bar before going out to dinner.  The female bartender was rude and was not very attentive, like we were not even there.  She was more interested in her buddy/boyfriend sitting at the bar.  Finally flipped us a drink menu and took her sweet time to take our order of $18/glass of wine.  Too many other great places in the  neighborhood  to get drinks and have a good time.

vHD6gH1GU9-qtTP_b-hypg.review_text: Super cute place local spot to grab a drink with friends for happy hour. I loved the decor, very classy old school glam vibe with a hint of rock and roll. They have a decent draft beer selection along with wine on tap (I'm a beer drinker).  Definitely come for happy hour because you get $2 off wine/beer on tap and select bottled beers until 7pm.

tzmgs00mXlirutoEFEyljQ.review_text: Best neighborhood spot in Hayes Valley.  Far and away the reason to come here is the staff. Michael, Brian, Jessica & Chase always make you so welcome and give a true neighborhood feel to the bar. I was recognized on my 2nd visit and known by name on my 3rd. They work really hard to create a great atmosphere. This is a great compliment to the fantastic wine, beer and food. To me, it's the best of both worlds--an upscale yet comfortable atmosphere where you feel like a local, even if you aren't.   Go, sit at the bar and meet a neighbor.

HCtEYgABFgwGhHB3rPQeQQ.review_text: I visited when they first opened. Beautiful space, loved the ambiance, but wasn't impressed with the wine list considering it's a wine bar. Anyhow, service could be better but I have it a 2nd chance and I love it now!!!  It's super busy most of the time so be prepared to wait.

W0oVnuBraYNVi9JooT5kzQ.review_text: This is a sort of odd place: wine bar + sports bar.  I'm not sure it really excels at either.  Furthermore, our waitress pronounced the grape "car-men-air-ee".  Dude.

D7AnOsCJim2M7JJ500yQpg.review_text: I walked in with three friends, we just thought we would have a couple of snacks and a beer or two. 3 hours later we tried practically every dish noir had to offer!   The bartender, I forget her name but she was amazing. Outstanding recommendations, and she personally made sure I had a new and unique beer to try. She was awesome and made me feel at  home.   The food was ridiculously good. Tots were my favorite. The steak was very flavorful, and the chicken waffle spinoff was to die for.  This is my new place! Ill be back very soon, this time with more friends

Al2_PuJueQ1llSXu3CyhJQ.review_text: Two words -- Absolutely Fabulous! A dinner for two or for a gang of girls. This is a lounge is that is super classy and truly speaks of San Francisco's elegance and international stature. A foodie heaven. From the menu, wine list to the desserts and pink champagne, Noir Lounge is a class act from the get go. The warmth is immediate as you stepped in and once inside, you can't help but to feel like you are in the company of the guys and girls of the 40s. Fashion wise? Fabulous! And the taste? Yummy! Go! And have a romantic good time!

QMcdzHEonGeATOaJqn1sXg.review_text: Love this place. It's cool and sophisticated. I like the decor, as well as the idea of watching a black and white movie while having a great wine from the Old World.

teiLGwYzSKXjCCk-PN0OnQ.review_text: Came here on a Weds evening and it was pretty packed. They were out of practically everything (fries, some wines, etc) but we still got to try a bit of this and a bit of that.    The wines weren't anything impressive - the server wasn't very good at giving me a recommendation based on what I wanted but it wasn't that big of a deal cuz I just wanted a glass or two of something easily drinkable (basically that means any wine).  Service was otherwise very attentive and the staff is crazy sweet.    We tried the following: gourmet tots: taste like mashed potato fried balls.  They come with sriracha ketchup but it isn't really spicy.  peach bruschetta: decent.  The bread is actually very soft.  lamborghini: the lamb burger buns are good, the burger is cheesy, and the lamb is very soft.  A little messy.  I added sriracha to mine. mac and cheese: insanely cheesy.    This is a cute date night location and is also good for small groups.  The booths are cozy, they play black and white movies, and the decor is fun and a little different.  There are two bars - one large one in front and a smaller one in the back.  The bathroom is actually clean.

vi1Ta_3XtGTqkl4p83ZbEQ.review_text: Super packed and super noisy on a Friday night.  More of a party scene than a wine lounge.  Never been to a lounge this loud.  Did I mention it was very noisy?

wyob7airQM-DG7V8aPBZ1w.review_text: Terrible service. I don't think I've ever given a poor rating solely based on service before, because generally I don't care too much about it. As long as I'm in good company and have some food or drink (and it's tasty), then I'm a happy camper. But Noir Lounge really did us a doozy last night.  We came in and tried to order a glass of wine at the bar. It took awhile for me to catch the attention of the lady behind the bar, and when I finally did, she told us to sit down and a server would come to us. Okay fine, but it then took around 10 minutes for someone to show up. We ordered our glasses of wine and proceeded to wait about 30 minutes! How long does it take to pour some wine? It wasn't like they were meticulously mixing a fancy cocktail or something.  The original server who took our order never reappeared, but at one point another guy came by our table and hovered to the side - I wasn't sure if he was a server or not. My friend assumed he was (correctly) and told him we'd already put in an order, but could he bring us some water. The water never arrived, and neither did the wine. So at the end of 30 minutes, I stood up and caught the eye of the lady behind the bar. As soon as she saw me looking, she realized we didn't have our drinks, and went and poured them. Okay, fine. She then handed them to the guest at the bar she'd been flirting with for the last half hour (rather than pouring our drinks) and asked him to hand them over to us at our table. Really? I prefer not to have some random guy handling my glass of wine before it's delivered to me, and in addition to that, he started flirting with her about handing the glass of wine over, so that he didn't actually turn around and give it to us until after a long, weird and awkward delay.  We drank our wine and while my friend liked her glass of Barbera okay, mine was just "meh" (some weird varietal from Italy I hadn't heard of before but wanted to give a try). I can't really blame Noir for the fact I didn't love the wine though. The same male server came back to our table and asked if we wanted another round. We said yes, and that we'd also appreciate some water. We both ordered the Barbera this time. He came back and told us they were out of it, but maybe we'd like the Grenache (since it was also a Spanish wine). We said okay. He then came back and told us they were also out of the Grenache. Really? He was the one who recommended it! Finally we picked a wine they actually still had, a California Cab (which was actually pretty good) and enjoyed our second round. Thank god my friend is good company!  We gave them a 10% tip which was more than they deserved but I've never given less. Oh well. Based on the good reviews for this place, maybe they were just having an off night. Regardless, I don't think I'll be coming back to Noir Lounge and if I'm in the area, will just hit up Two Sisters next door instead.

YEKy3CEFI23R49tpqlMvbg.review_text: Been here twice, and both times were really great.  The seating isn't cramped, and it gives you and your group enough room to actually have a conversation. The wine list seems to have something for all pallets, and the servers are quite knowledgeable on the options presented.  In terms of food, they don't have any full meals, but their general appetizers menu should do quite well for you. I was a fan of their cheesy tater tots creation.

gji92ao5NAIrb3akKyqTZQ.review_text: This place is pretty great. Tons of space, three seperate seating areas, standing table, multiple pieces of gorgeous furniture. Popcorn to snack on, great by the glass and bottle list. Service was pretty good. I'm looking forward to returning and trying out the food.

7rvHvqtLYXchl7xxwkv94A.review_text: Noir Lounge is right in the heart of Hayes Valley, making it a good central meeting spot. The poutine packs a punch in the best way. The wine list is solid. The space is roomy with both bar seating, booths and tables. Most importantly, the service is stellar. The GM went out of his way to make sure all the tables were happy. And we were!

VcPj1gchy48KWnMk4kMI-A.review_text: holy shmoley those meetinghouse biskits are good!  i had them at the Elite Cafe too, but never actually got to eat at the Meetinghouse.  not sure why i felt the need to tell you that.    anyway, this place is really good, and it's not because i have a crush on the British waitress.  she's freakishly pleasant to look at.  funny story: i asked a patron where the bathroom was, because i thought she worked there on the basis of the fact that she was sitting at the long table (with a glass of wine, no less) which i mistook for the bar.  i just had LASIK eye surgery, m'kay?  and i'm stupid.  okay, back to the waitress.  wait, i mean back to the food.  we had the tater tots, which were really good....not too overtly greasy, but i'm sure it wasn't low-fat.  the deviled eggs were excellent, and a great source of vitamin D.  the arugula salad with the fried pancetta was huge and awesome.  the salt cod potato puree was good....sorta random to be putting what is ostensibly mashed taters on crostini, but who am i to say "no" to carbs on carbs?

K6677dAZZIsf-OO8fKvIdQ.review_text: They had just gotten their liquor license a few days ago when I had visited. Limited cocktails listed on the menu so I tried to order two different cocktails neither of which they could make (a gin fizz I think is pretty standard). Martini was a shell of a real martini. Ended up having an old fashioned which had a minimal amount of whiskey and mostly tasted like watery orange juice. I pulled 5 ice cubes out of the glass trying to actually taste the drink. I would have paid $3 for it, not $10.  The service was great. The atmosphere was...trying too hard. Nice though. They had a variety of different kinds of tables. Seems like the place to go if you want wine. ordered a plate of olives. Gave us a ton for $5- impressed on that part definitely. Beers were crazy expensive for just a lagunitas. I feel like this is the place I would go if every other nice bar was packed or out of liquor. I don't know much about wines, but seems like their main thing is wine.

WJnEifJRkI6bCH2iw8brFg.review_text: I've lived in Hayes for years and we *desperately* needed a place like this...   Went here today with my girlfriend and both enjoyed a couple glasses of wine and their food... everything from the knowledgable/professional bartenders, greetings from the owner, fast service from the server/chefs was just great. Prices very reasonable, too.   Have to admit I was skeptical about trying this place after reading a few of the negative reviews, but just goes to show it's so subjective and check it out for yourself to form your own opinion.  Very recommended, looking forward to returning. :)

rBRuie_HNzxCkMDF-ooRog.review_text: OMG I absolutely love Noir! It's the epitome in my mind what a wine bar in the city should be. I was immediately enamored by the vintage yet modern decor with the cozy chairs / couches and the eclectic inviting bar. I absolutely love how the flat screen TVs were encased in a huge picture frame and was playing a black & white old classic movie. Last night, I have no idea what the movie was, but when I was here the first time it was during the holidays and they were playing the Jimmy Stewart movie: "It's a Wonderful Life". But the movie was silent because they were playing music.   This is a great date place or to catch up with a group of friends. My girlfriend & I just had light dinner @ Domo and I wanted her to check out the place before my date arrived. Thought for sure he would be running late since it was raining last night... Really wasn't planning to double book, but she travels a lot, so I wanted to see her before she left for DC this week. Ugh. Well Thank God my date was cool about it.  Oh and Jarek... Hope I didn't butcher our Irish sommelier's name... He was phenomenal. I enjoyed each & every wine glass he suggested. My date ordered the meatballs & flank steak..... OMG both were unbelievably delicious!  And an added plus was the bathrooms were not unisex; the women's bathroom was clean & big for a wine bar! I'm guessing the men's were the same, but not for sure on that one.  I can't wait to come back:)

gXZDZZPqVdd1wwC2Ach8Fg.review_text: My boyfriend and I came here to grab a quick drink before dinner and were impressed with the cherry cider we drank, but not as impressed with the service here!  We luckily found a small table to sit at and no one bothered to come by with drink menus for at least 5 minutes. When I finally made it up to the mini-bar area and bought our cider, the girl told me she was going away and to get my drink at the front bar? Like you really couldn't go grab it yourself for me and bring it over since it's your job? I passed my boyfriend at our table en route to pick up our drinks from the front bar and he was now magically given menus (???). I brought my receipt up to the bartender who then promptly told me that they "usually don't do this" and took my receipt. Cool. Now I don't have a receipt and was berated for doing what the girl behind the other bar told me to do.  Long story short, good drinks and terrible service.

vgwdQ0fpDZdoTidJuwYq7w.review_text: I was really worried about another fancy ass wine bar in my 'hood. But Noir came along with it's big TVs (with Giants games & classic films), fluffy chairs & couches, many nooks & good food. Oh, they have wine too. The only pratfall is they close early on weekends. Otherwise I just adore this new addition to Hayes.

Z88N6qly3Dp5C06XbZ9IMQ.review_text: Meeoooww.  With its gold painted ceilings and leather armchairs, Noir is a hot little date spot. Seek out the quiet back salon where B&W film plays on the wall, sit on the creamy vintage loveseat and curl up next to your gorgeous man.  The wine list is rich in California varietals and sprinkled with well picked European choices. We shared a bottle of white: crisp, light and a bit on the sweet side. Forgive me, I couldn't remember the name, my brain is still foggy from the luscious kisses on my lips. * Vesper fanning herself *  Thanks Noir for sexing up Hayes Valley.

IBrL-6twlZmQBGLdV2DQiw.review_text: Was great for brunch with girlfriends.  Check their menu out.  Crowd-pleaser dishes but made with some twist that make a lot of them just unctuous.  Pair that with their fun mimosas - like pomegranate or passionfruit - and their great service, and you don't mind that it's not that crowded....  Definitely sit by the front windows in the daytime.  It can be dark in the back...  Oh, Noir...  got it.

jkKYuWGmW6JYSQFhluKAfg.review_text: Wish I could give Noir 10 stars! A group of friends and I went to Noir Saturday night and we had fantastic experience.  Noir is a perfect spot to enjoy a bottle of wine and some conversation - the atmosphere is comfortable, relaxed, and inviting.   We enjoyed two bottles of Alexandria Nicole Cabernet from Washington which was a classy, rich and layered red loaded with dark fruit.  Unbelievable Cabernet for the value and I'm excited to go back for more!  Great job and thank you Noir!

yjUFGJ-8MAqJS2GKUjWr1Q.review_text: Atmosphere is nice but service is terrible.  You can easily wait more than 20 minutes for your drinks order.

P5O3WWL3tb-WKv-0D4UuMQ.review_text: I really love this place, between bar-lounge and tapas-restaurant. Great ambiance with piano live, Lovely staff...  Good wine and tasty food make me happy. I definitly will come back again and again...

lLUoy7xdsiOCmyqgQG0o0Q.review_text: Went here with a few friends for a reunion. Atmosphere was lively but not too loud--perfect because we could still hold a conversation at only slightly above normal volume. None of us ventured into the wine list, we all stuck with beers (I know, I know) but they were all great and well-priced at $7 each.   Service was a touch on the slow side, but they were having some sort of computer issue, so definitely extenuating circumstances. What's more, because of aforementioned computer issue there was a bit of a long wait for our second round of beers, and as a result they comped the whole round for us. (This was a genuinely nice gesture, as we are all very easygoing, and it hadn't even been that long of a wait anyways.) Very appreciative.  Overall, a very pleasant evening and I'll definitely be back!

7qON9j4tjggvZpW7rrSxrg.review_text: Beautiful bar, great service and a tantalizing menu! Love having this bar in my neighborhood. Great place to chill and play dice during the week. A must go!  Order the chicken and waffles and poutine with a session beer on the side.

Oq2dXkIJEjPLWpVQWI6EWg.review_text: Awesome, unique place that now has full bar so you can slow sip on some cocktails while kicking back and absorbing the scene. Great service, great beer (and wine) on tap, and just one of those unique places in SF that is great for locals or tourists. One of my top 5 places to go to in the city.

crxhOesQjRjlPr9tuqralA.review_text: Love, love, love this spot! Obsessed with the atmosphere. Slightly dark, lounge-y, rich red furniture with a dainty twist. Hardwood floors, beautiful hardwood long community table, elegant chandelier. And...they have a movie theater in the back that plays classic films (a soundless tv plays them up front too). I've only stopped here for happy hour with friends (great prices on the menu) to grab a beer, but I look forward to coming back.

dXdXagdSU6od-w6TjBFKbg.review_text: My girlfriend and I tried out this little lounge on a Wednesday night since the Biergarten's line was insane. It wasn't too packed at 6pm and the décor is lovely and homey. We had a great waitress and they play classic films in the background!! We both ordered the Prosecco and relaxed in the big red booths they have all around. Its so nice to have a few options in Hayes Valley now. Around 7:30pm it was packed so I suggested you get there early and don't leave your seat. I hear the food is great and the fries on the table next to us looked delish! If you don't find anything on the menu you like they have a self serve popcorn machine.

u58FjSNB9K9ST_FQ5SAT3g.review_text: Noir was exactly what my group needed.  We put in our order at Paxtis and headed over.  The bar had a couple of open tables and we were welcomed the moment we walked in.  Service was great and friendly, and everyone in our group enjoyed their wine or beer.  This would be a great date night place.  I thought it was beautifully decorated.  I would highly reccommend stopping by before or after a meal in the area, the volume is great for group or one on one conversation.

UyhnjAlyMXtbR-qB5kkhlQ.review_text: Noir Lounge has a good layout and plenty of tables and seats for chilling with friends. Not too crowded or loud so we were actually able to hold conversations. Good service. Wine and beer only. Average prices. Last call before 11:30pm on Friday.   A huge drawback? It stank in here. The space reeked of some combination of spilled alcohol, vomit, and mold. It looked clean enough, so I am not sure where the odor came from. After over an hour there, I could still smell it, and it caused me mild nausea all night.

P_vMhoUEQjEwg8jQ5-XfgQ.review_text: Great location for a low profile brunch. Do try chicken and waffles w/ a glass or two of Cab Franc Blanc.

qA9H_2ajSa7m2SckdsUb2g.review_text: Just celebrated a friend's birthday here, we had a great time.  Good value for the money.  Great place for drinks and nibbles.  Service was pretty good, especially when you considered that they were absolutely full.  Two things to consider if you are thinking of this place: - It's really loud, we had to almost shout to carry a conversation. - If you are sitting in the back, you get almost no cell reception.  For me, this is usually a plus since I don't like phone conversations with dinner, but we were waiting for a couple of people who were running late, so we had to run outside a couple of times to get updates on their progress.  Really good selection of wines and beers, and at a fairly decent price.  The food menu was somewhat limited, so good for drinks and nibbles, but not a lot of choices if you want a full dinner.  We had the following: - Biscuits - good flaky biscuits with honey butter. - Tater tots - not your typical Orida tots.  The texture was a lot smoother (like mash potatoes) with a cheese in the middle.  Definitely very good. - Blue cheese sandwich bites - the blue cheese overpowers anything else, you can barely taste the grilled bread.  Not  that this is a bad thing, a definite plus if you like blue cheese. - Swedish meatballs with egg noodles - this was good, but I think it pales when compared to everything else that we had.  After having everything else, especially the blue cheese grilled cheese, the flavors on this dish just didn't stand out.   Service was pretty good.  Yes, sometimes we had to wait a little but they were really packed.  My one complaint is that based on their website, I thought that they would have more options for big plates/dinner.  I think only one of the large plates listed on their website was on the menu.  Yes, they had other large plates on the menu, but I am sorry, chili is not a dinner option for me.

eo0Eab67OD3oqcitIpX3HQ.review_text: Cool spot! I was there for a quick beer before heading back to Marin and had a lovely time, bartender was friendly,decor is cool and neat with lots of beautiful ladies...watching Casablanca in the background was inspiring and felt like I was in Paris! I will be back...

qsQ3_nPBgdmF6a_6lcsA6A.review_text: What an absolute treat this place is...it's got the right amount of everything. It has plenty of places to cozy up next to a date or commune as a group to let the day melt away. With a serpentine like lay out, even when it's packed, your section never feels too crowded. And having the back room showing old movies, with the bar showing Giants games/sports everyone is happy. The food is delicious and interesting, and the wine menu is fantastic, I've tried a handful of the wines by the glass and have been impressed by all of them.   The staff help enhance the whole experience, they are very accommodating and always brighten my mood.   It's fantastic to have such a great new spot around the corner from my office and I highly recommend it.

JseBksW8DVL596kJ18GGpA.review_text: I may be bridge and tunnel now, but I still make it to Mommas Wine night once a month and August was Noir Lounge. There is something for every occasion here--tall, long communal table for happy hour-ers and small groups, lively bar by the front door, nice tables of different sizes further back for those who want to eat and talk, and the boudoir-ish back room with low tables and comfy chairs and a black and white film playing. I'd love to have an intimate birthday party on the back room.   The wine and service were excellent. Both of our servers read the vibe that we wanted good wine and snacks but mostly wanted to catch up, so they gave us quick, spot-on recommendations and checked on us just the right amount (well you could say I was over served b/c I had a 1.5-day hangover).   I'm recommending Noir to everyone right now. Well worth the Hayes Valley Parking drag.

JnGtgOPpkjyWOvWM0SYEXg.review_text: meeting with the ladies...some casual tables and booths near entrance along wall..lighting through windows only...rest of the lounge dim...bar along other side...walking deeper and finding little more cozy and intimate tables in darker atmosphere...bottle of other people's pinot (o.p.p.) waiting along with a cone of fries...easy sipping wine..smooth aged wood with subtle fruity and flower sweetness..priced bit high...marking up to $52 a bottle for a roughly $20 market-price wine...enjoying company and ordering a 2nd with dinner orders...tasty cheesy tots and beet salad quite standard good...steak excellent and accompanying salad quite awesome...apple cider vinegar,  honey mustard, scallions,  salt and pepper dressing...so simple, yet so flavorful....requesting more salad and chase accommodating request with a salad for extra $5...atmosphere is quite comfortable....cinema room with sofa lounging if preferred...tables, bars or booths...perfect seating or atmosphere for drinks, talk and food...bit heavy mark-up on wine, but service and food was perfect....$210 total after tip for 3....

v4OqcE77gEAelwYU8lbP7w.review_text: We've been looking forward to Noir opening in Hayes since Frijtz announced the closure and the Noir concept first started circulating on Grub Street. We lived two blocks away and were excited another cute wine bar would be opening. Due to the usual delays of inspections in the city of San Francisco we moved out to the East Bay. But we visited recently and had a mixed visit.  For starters: The interior is, dare I say, perfect. Absolutely beautiful and I love the flood of... well... noir. It feels like I'm stepping into an old movie. The lighting is so wonderfully textured and dramatic I'm just ready to sit down and enjoy our visit. The wines are good and the drink service is on top of their game. This is a great place for a drink and some small bites with friends. The biscuits were great, I only wish for more.  But... Our table ordered a pork entree that wasn't to our liking. It seemed to be more of a salad with a few potatoes tucked in and some pork with it. We didn't feel it lived up two the expectation of what a place like this would offer. A manager came to our table and graciously took it off of our bill and offered us something else.  One of my friends at the table asked for hot water for tea (since Noir didn't have tea at that time, our server offered to bring the hot water). They brought us a cup of hot water and a slice of lemon. So we made our own tea. No big deal. I don't hold that against them. My friend finished her tea and left the lemon untouched on her saucer. The cup was cleared and came back refilled with hot water! Nice. And two slices of lemon, debatably the first unused one and a fresh one. Not so nice. And the used tea bag. Awkward. I, not so graciously, point this out to our server. She takes care of it and returns later to check on us and is a little antagonistic about not "knowing any better." That interaction really put me off.   All in all I think Noir is a beautiful location for a few small bites and wine with friends or a date. They should really focus on that.

NjSqtEFFkK49k2CZoyfY-Q.review_text: Nice place for drinks.  WIne is pretty good.  But don't bother with the food.  The food is ok but waay overpriced.  And the service was really bad.  It took awhile for someone to come take our order even after asking at the bar about it several times.  Then our order was messed up not once but twice.

1cKbvepUTL5lZcC9odITUg.review_text: What a cool place! Warm with a great layout, convenient location, wines at a Great price point. This place is beautiful wine bar!

ydQ8SD98-6XJ42-x52H8gg.review_text: I gave them  a very healthy tip. Why then did they feel a need to put my charge through as more than the signed for amount?

PPgyaeI9Y52VErV5uHTDYQ.review_text: This is a super cute wine bar in Hayes Valley! But for a wine bar, i didn't feel that the selection of wines was that great.. I'm no sommelier so I'm not going to dock a bunch of stars off for that. I loved the decor and the food was actually very good! I'd actually probably come back for the food more than the wine!  We ordered around 8 dishes...all I remember was biscuits with honey butter and the risotto being amazing!

C469FeAyiATdaNmgXjZYWQ.review_text: Good for a drink, especially in a smaller crowd. They have an almost cozy living-room like setup showing old movies in the back; a piano bar midway through; and a lounge/bar in the front. If I could, I'd draw out some ASCII dungeon diagram, but a quick walk will do it (better) justice.  I always forget that they close early, since they're not a spirits bar (or maybe, because it's Hayes Valley). As a result, I've been conditioned to avoid this place when it's dark out. NG.  Personally, I prefer a more intimate wine and beer bar -- it gives me the chance to talk to the owner/bartenders on their stock and why. In here, I feel hip and isolated in a roomful of people. Which is also cool, but not something I do every weekend.

570kiZ_3AyLYNKpihpA05A.review_text: Wound up here one evening and had a grand time! Among the group I was with, we split many different appetizers but just one bottle of champagne for celebration so... good review for food, lacking review for wine aspect:   APPETIZERS:  Gourmet Tots - GET THEM. I don't even like tots and I gobbled these up. They're liked Crispy-lined mashed potato cheese balls. Just get them. Trust me.   Beet Salad - Probably yummy on its own but really lacking in comparison to how flavorful and awesome everything else was.   Mac and Cheese  - Solid classic. Rich. Yummy.   Skillet Brussel Sprouts  - The BEST. A perfect blend of brussel sprouts and the remaining smorgasbord of ingredients. You'll want to lick the plate clean... just sayin...  SERVICE: Kind, attentive, fast.   ATMOSPHERE: Dark lighting - half macabre/half romantic. They have a room with a projector playing old films. Definitely a great place to chill and have good conversation, its not too loud AND you feel all classy because they have a piano player.

CyQlabNTX0OnnosYgkPKnA.review_text: Excellent ambiance and beautiful place in a perfect location. But I am worried about the service. All 4 times I have been (because it is so beautiful and convenient and I want to support it) the service was less than ok. Some if the staff are actually nice but require some serious training, from making sure orders come to checking in often. Also, when it first opened, it had scrumptious little plates, but they already switched chefs and I thought that the food now, although still tasty, is not as delicious as before. I hope they figure out the service soon and continue to thrive.

3rBc0Y1AB3lmnbhxnTH88g.review_text: Sold ambience, great place for dates/small groups to talk, great wine selection!

HR1fzigQjYRvtSZGWOIN9Q.review_text: I thought this place would be classy, but really it's just a sports bar with a gaudy interior.  Clearly all these reviews are from friends of the owners.  I won't waste my time coming here again.

QFnNGxQVNf2OatvTLo5fbg.review_text: Fantastic beer selection with rotating taps which gets it to 4 stars in if itself :). But then I began ordering the food and it blew away my expectations. At first reading, I was disappointed as it is heavy on fried foods.  I started with the baked gigs: the home made ricotta was sets this dish above others. Cheese and bread lovers understand the difference between fresh curdled cheese/hot out of the oven bread from store bought.  Next I had the lobster empanadas which were better than expected, but in the interest of time I will skip over. The pièce de résistance was was recommended by the bartender so I don't know how it is described on the menu, but it was crepe with something akin to crème fraiche with a side of fresh chantilly mushrooms, spinach and fried egg covering it all. A perfect blend for this noshing pallet.  Oh, and after I finished the guy next me had the chicken and waffles and looks to be eminently enjoying himself.  If fried food looks like this, then I am all in!!

qiPwKC0spUneRV74nxG9Xw.review_text: I don't think there isn't anything we haven't tried off the menu. It's all fabulous. Been there with a large group and with just 2 people. The waitresses are all wonderful. The ambiance is beyond incredible - especially the back room. I feel like I get to have "Midnight in Paris' moments. If this place were closer to home I'd be a regular. Right now I consider it a treat and go as much as I can. It's a gem.

51DacJvYh42ttaz53ofrWQ.review_text: Went here for the first time tonight and the food was really top-notch for bar appetizers.  Just a bunch of small dishes that were much better than similar fare I'd had at other restaurants/bars.  I had a great Imperial Porter (10% ABV) from a very curated list that rotates every few days (mostly very strong beers) and was impressed with the overall wine and beer selection on their static list.  It has a great vibe with noir films playing everywhere, but overall not a very loud place and much larger than it looks. If it's comfortably spacious on Memorial Day Weekend Saturday, I imagine it's probably never super packed or real loud.

I-FmdvI28N7OIIt4JZOgIg.review_text: Entering Noir, made me feel like I was entering the 20s era!  I love the ambiance and dimly lit setting to this romantic wine venue!  They have a living room with luxurious cushioned lounge wear and a flat screen television that showcases black and white films.   It's a leisurely and enjoyable time spent here, while sipping on some wine and mini appetizers.  The lounge area, offers a bit of seclusion and intimacy that you just can't quite find elsewhere in the city from a wine venue.  I prefer reds over whites here!  Their Domestic Pinot Noir Oregogne 2010 was clean on tasting and Spain Garnacha Vina Alarba 2011, had hints of spices and flavor, if you prefer the non-subtleness of wine.  Noir offers a grand variety of wines to choose from and a marvelous dining decor.    Simply said, I love Noir.

g2hQYumU1nGsneneavMA1g.review_text: I came here after dinner for drinks and dessert.  I found a seat in the back room where it had a few small tables with chairs and a sofa. It kind of reminded me of someone's family room.     I heard that the bread pudding was good.  I love bread pudding!  I asked for coffee with my dessert not knowing that they would have it.  Sure enough, the waiter said they would make me a cup.  When the waiter brought my coffee, he said it would be on the house.  Apparently, the next day they were going to start serving brunch and they wanted my opinion of the coffee.  At that late hour, I thought the coffee was good.  It was very aromatic and on the lighter side.  I normally don't drink coffee after 6 pm because it keeps me awake, but I didn't have a problem going to bed.  On the other hand, I like my coffee stronger for brunch.  When the bread pudding came out, as it was set on the table, I saw it jiggle a bit.  That's a good sign.  When I dug into it, it was light and airy.  The flavors were really good.  It wasn't too sweet and it was served warm!  I'd have to say, it was one of the best bread pudding I have had!  I also had a sip of the Banchee Mordecai Red.  Yum!  Fruity and complex!  I asked the waiter if he could play a movie since the screen was in some standby mode.  A black and white Alfred Hitchcock played in the background as my friend and I chatted up a storm. The music didn't quite match the ambiance.  Hipster groups like Empire of the Sun was playing.  This is definitely a cool hangout spot for drinks and dessert.

6vnAwDEa66GB9-3P5wELZQ.review_text: I came here for a drink with a date of mine before dinner.  I was surprised how large of a space this is and very tastefully decorated, the layout of the tables and chairs provides ample seating and its pretty easy to navigate.   The hostess Sara was absolutely fabulous, seated us promptly and was very attentive even if she wasn't our cocktail waitress.  I will definitely come again

dnGIi-OjEui4OSsmLQ2lPw.review_text: Ooh, I kind of love Noir Lounge.   I would go to NL solely for the Ambiance. It is all dark and a little sexy inside. The lighting is low and candlelit, which lends itself to making everyone look attractive. Even me. And I went dressed like Holly Hobby.   But before things get too sexy, there is a live pianist that bangs the bejesus out of them ivories. If you are sitting in the back, it's quite loud. If you don't like the company you're with, this is good times. Just nod and act like you can't hear. I quite liked the pianist's repertoire. He played Keane's "Somewhere Only We Know," and Soundgarden's "Black Hole Sun," among others. I got so excited when he played Soundgarden, I nearly fell out of my chair. That's just cool, you know?   I skipped the wine and got a beer-a Pilsner Urquell. My friend ordered a Scotch Ale from a Colorado brewery, which he didn't like. Score! I drank his too. I thought they had a nice beer list. I can't remember it very well now because of all that beer.   The food smelled so good and my stomach was eating itself, but I didn't stick around long, so I had to pass. Next time.   The parking around NL (Hayes Valley) will make you want to light yourself on fire. I parked in front of a church and defied them to have my vehicle towed. I was sweating it the whole time (another reason I had to peace out). Can you believe how terrible parking can be on a random Monday night?   Other than that, pretty cool. You'll look so hot here. First date central, for sure.

2h1B3IUp1TejELkxfffEkg.review_text: As a former SF chef & restaurant manager I am always skeptical about a new neighborhood restaurant opening up in my community. While I've only lived in Hayes Valley for 3 years I'm very concerned about what new establishments are opening and what kind of impact they will have on the neighborhood.   Last night I visited Noir Lounge. I was very impressed with the overall look & feel of the space. They completely transformed the old Frijtz location and it's a huge improvement. We sat in the back screening room and watched Vertigo on the big screen. The place was buzzing with patrons and the vibe was pleasant and relaxing.   Shortly after ordering a glass of wine (at 9:15 pm), we were greeted by the manager who very nicely informed us that they were closing at 10pm. We then learned that the neighborhood association when issuing their permit required them to close at 10pm daily. THIS IS ABSURD! Why would the neighborhood association do this? All of the other restaurants in Hayes Valley have licenses to stay open until after 11pm. The bars are licensed to stay open until 2am.   Noir Lounge is a nice addition to the neighborhood and I'm confident they will do well if the city will loosen restrictions to their operating hours. I'm not sure how a business can survive with such limitations and wish them great success.

LfnRtbyBps71jpojEPE3eA.review_text: What a fun place my daughter and I stumbled on when we were in SF for the weekend. We sat in the back room and had a couple glasses of wine, some appetizers and watched Casablanca.  A great way to spend a Sunday afternoon and a perfect end to a great weekend!

wiS1TMqEEIC1A3pmrPBSJA.review_text: What a nice atmosphere!  We sat in the screening room and watched Casa Blanca.  Excellent selection of wines and draft beer.  The food is perfect to accompany a chat and drink.  Their small (not so small) plates are luscious.  A couple could share two plates and have a few drinks and easily be satisfied.  I love the selection of food, its eclectic, so there is something to please everyone, vegetarian and meat lover alike.  Trust the pleasant staff with your drink pairing.  Great service with out being overbearing, but there when you need them.

O13YdpM9qFqnp1NbjTBNsg.review_text: LOVED this place. Went for a drink with my boyfriend. We found a nice, quiet table but there were many larger tables with groups - this was around 9PM on a Friday.
