The ambiance and design of the bar are very cool. Lots of lounge/couch seating as well as big wooden chairs. The service was super fast for the amount of people there. The basket of fries were delicious!

pSms5uzIwl_eM6Gi7vVFYQ.review_text: Great scene with a sense of intrigue created by the velvet chairs, draped curtains, romantic (read: low) lighting, etc. but unless you have a few hours to wait each time you want to have an exchange with the waitstaff, I'd recommend you go elsewhere. Case in point: the wine selection is nice and we wanted to order a second glass but by the time we were able to flag the waiter down, it was late so I just asked for the check. Oh and the good was good but not great - 2 Sisters (right next door) has better offerings!

vH-hR18SO5WL_HadjSXMmg.review_text: I have been to Noir twice..at night but never on b'fast or lunch. So when my friend told me they are open for Sunday brunch, I really wanted to give it a try. Honestly, I was just curious to see if this place is still beautiful at daytime. It is and some more...  The chicken & waflles are amazing!!!! I even said theirs is better than FarmerBrown's! I feel like I betrayed a loyal friend just saying that!   My friend tried they mushroom omelette and it's yummy too! I like the rosted garlic on the omelette.   All in all, their b'fast menu is simple, unpretentious, short & yummy. I will definitely go back & try something else on the list.   Oh, the crew are as friendly as the people at night!   Kudos Noir!

t1NmJ-g09NijXqycgF-evA.review_text: Yum! Great ambiance and comfortable tables that aren't too close together. We stopped in here while waiting for a dinner table at Suppenkuche. The olive plate was good, although I wish there'd been a better black / green olive ratio, and the lamb sliders were nice and juicy. We tried their two sour beers. I liked the cherry one and my date didn't. The service was very nice, a little on the slow side (confusing bc they were fairly empty) but nothing major. I would definitely recommend this place if you're in the area!

rVA85dMsTw7B6v2opDuMuQ.review_text: Whoa this place was REALLY COOL. Ambiance was very nice, and the place is deceptively large (a few quieter, private rooms, choice of tables, including a really long one toward the back). I loved it because I could actually have a conversation without having to yell, and the lighting was nice. Came here a little after New Years, when they still had winter decor up, which made the place EVEN CUTER.  Had a mushroom bruschetta, yum. Prices are high but oh well, it's Hayes Valley.

A8piN4-8W7hfxtDUVJEUDg.review_text: what a great find near the civic center/hayes valley area! great ambiance, classy and love the old school films. My friend and I grabbed a drink and the sweet potato tots which were delish. Couple of suggestions since they seem to still be tweaking 1) Please have a happy hour, love the fact you guys open early but why not have HH specials!! 2) you're one of the few bars that opens early so please keep that, it is awesome! 3) we had a female server, she was friendly but almost too intrusive, so let your guests chill out and have a great time   looking forward to coming back :)

_cUHHH6Qk8t6xTA-aMbMYA.review_text: The place is very nice, beautiful decor, nice atmosphere. However the food is horrible. Re-heated pasta, overpriced and generally not good tasting.

FAbdbUdGEsahol2PVMrsAg.review_text: After a delicious dinner that knocked my date's socks off and me too full for dessert 'round the corner, we strolled down Hayes and looked into this spot.  Two empty glasses on the bar, two empty stools, no one smoking outside.  Glanced at my date, we both nodded as the slim well dressed male bartender cleared the glasses.  It was like fate had invited us in.   Maybe it was the great company, or the friendly female bartender with the most amazing red/white/blue earrings that knew when to pour another glass of wine, or the great weather, post Prop 8, post-DoMA joy of the Friday, whatever it was, it was terrific.  When the guy behind the bar asked me how my Friday was going, he threw me off because he just seemed so damn sincere that I answered honestly, "Pretty fucking good!"   Funky, conversation starting taps behind the bar, huge men's bathroom, big communal table, food too.  Self service popcorn by the bathrooms, but it was empty this particular night...and having seen it firsthand, there is NOTHING sadder than an empty old school popcorn cart on display. Stuck to the same glass of white all night long.   I'd cozy up to the bar after work or serves as a nice 1st/date/after date spot. Wonder what the weekend scene is like...potential to be great.

Lu3HIBJoGUAp-Gb3_a_elQ.review_text: Classy wine bar. Super plush chairs. Lives up to the name. Feels like something out of a black-and-white gangster movie. Was playing some Hitchcock movie on the wall. Only had one dessert wine. Guess they are for real wine-snobs only =)

5-3b4IHx3EIMu-pX1cDHYQ.review_text: Great new bar.  Must try the chicken and waffles!

MtV_ehFusGwykpvlaKD-uQ.review_text: I live in Hayes Valley and had stopped by for wine when they first opened and liked it but nothing moved me to come back. I yelped brunch places on my lazy Sunday and landed back at Noir. The service was over the top inviting warm and genuine. The food was perfect and the wine list fantastic!!!! My new neighborhood go to place. Well done!!!

innCVAQvYyduI7uHbV7ssQ.review_text: My wife and I came here before a show and we were very impressed.  The ambiance is fantastic!  Romantic, dimly lit, and very comfortable.  The service was amazing.  Both the waitstaff and the manager checked on us the perfect amount of times.  And last but certainly not least, the wine and food was great!  I had the steak and my wife had the chicken, each were delightful.  We shared a bottle of the OPP Pinot Noir, which was equally as fantastic.  When I am back in town, there is no doubt about where we'll  be headed.  Bravo Noir Lounge!

LTI86BSXBclY6UsZXqKYXw.review_text: MOVIE time with WINE.   This place is a recently opened wine lounge near Hayes Valley.  Ambiance: The restaurant offers an unique combination of wine lounge with a 1900's background theme. The restaurant has a cool projector in the back which shows classic cinemas. Additionally, there is a popcorn maker near the middle of the place where you can grab some while waiting for a table.  Food: There is a wide selection of food ranging from tater tots, smoked gouda cheese, to desserts such as bread budding. There is also a wide selection of wines around 50. The wines are great pairing with the food and definitely offers a different experience compared to other wine bars.  Service: The service at this establishment can definitely improve. We waited about 45 minutes to get a check, which I thought was quite long. The waiters seemed confused and disorganized and came by multiple times thinking they gave us our check. Besides the poor service, this is an interesting place to try out.  Overall: This place has a lot of potential to be a big hit in Hayes. Hope to come back again soon.

Skd2_Jiw4XAjbBBws3ia7w.review_text: Good atmosphere, good food, good choice of alcohol and then boom!!! Loud music. Not like the radio is loud, but dude suddenly plays the grand piano in the corner. Not a random guy, but a designated guy. If he was good maybe it would be fine but he pounds on the piano really loud, and he makes so many mistakes, sometimes not even finishing songs. Didn't even have an extensive repertoire. People are yelling at each other to be heard at the tables next to me, I lost my will to talk. Good except the piano.

kN2HQbVCAB-XNRMXw861Vg.review_text: This is a gem for the neighborhood! I came here on a Sunday and claimed the couch by the front window for the afternoon with a Times Sunday crossword -- could not have found a better spot to pass the day. The wine and beer selection was great and pretty unique, and we were super pleasantly surprised with the crab fritters app, and then with the risotto and the chicken entrees. The ambiance is impeccable and the service was flawless. I already have my plans for the next rainy Sunday..

-HgGrg2UZgKA8iELR4rgEg.review_text: A few friends were visiting from out of town so I wanted to show them Hayes Valley. We came across this wine bar and decided to share a bottle of wine after lunch at Arlequin.   We loved the decor and concept of the lounge, especially the back room with the comfy couches and projector on the back wall that plays old black and white movies.  We didn't try the food so I can't speak to the quality and the wine glasses had a funny smell inside... The service was also a little slow for the most part because it was one girl running around the busy bar. She was really friendly and recommended her favorite wine...  I just wish she had more help.   I'd definitely come back!

l-vxPfXBKA_LhkkBdM7rsw.review_text: My fiancé and I hosted an event here this past Thursday, and the staff was so fabulously helpful. There had been a few email misses that made it a bit difficult to get hold of each other on both ends, but they were gracious about everything. They also worked to resolve any anxiety I had in response to missed emails. We reserved the back area and it was the perfect space to host 30-40 people. The ambiance was great for connecting with people as the dim lights and vintage couch invite you to linger. The old movie playing in the back room added some fun for everyone, including the 2 sweet children who were a bit bored while surrounded by adults. I also have to say, for a wine bar - they give excellent service to children. They poured them root beers in "fancy" glasses and were very welcoming. Considering the neighborhood and how elegant the space was I was a bit nervous that they would be a bit snobby about kids, but everything about this place is inviting. I wasn't sure what to order for people to nibble on, and they were very helpful. They talked to me about the menu so I could plan appropriate bites for our guests that would be both elegant and filling.  Through the night the service was impeccable, and even as we lingered in the back room and the place started filling up, they didn't rush us. I hope to host an event here again soon.

W7cXRCRMk7fV1HYEQhGYNQ.review_text: Nice clean bar with a lot of different seating options depending on how big or small your group is.  Plasma TV's throughout the bar for your viewing pleasure.  Great wine selection. I didn't really look at the beer selection b/c I don't drink beer.  They have free popcorn (self service).

WnHR5MapKxVsBpog8hIvbw.review_text: Ornate, current, with screens on the wall playing films from a bygone era. A pianist hammers felt on steel strings to produce bebop fructose.  An inviting lounge in the back there, with a beautiful white tufted couch.  Drinks anyone?

brJDrKFzyIg3nP8gzH1Q2Q.review_text: Excellent service, excellent food. Chicken is softer than a baby. Asparagus is crisp and garlicky. Lamb could use a bit more flavor but was very tender.

gq-APHARCChYnEBHRF1A1g.review_text: So not sure where the flamers are coming from, but I also live in the hood, and this place is sexy, the servers are very approachable, responsive, and not difficult to look at! And there is free popcorn served on the old fritz French fry holders- nice touch. Wines on tap are surprisingly fresh and tasty and at least mildly interesting (for those who have wine on tap before, I was skeptical..).  To all the flamers: this place is still in its soft opening, and has been for less than a week. In fact, the varnish on the bar is still drying, literally!! Food is currently being served via pop-up kitchen....so to all the haters who are nit-picky complainers- chill out! Enjoy the extensive wine list and comfy and sexy decor!  I definitely enjoyed, and I will definitely be returning in short order.

UQFE3BT1rsIYrcDvu_XVow.review_text: This place was good the first week it opened, and now, well... the word "great" just doesn't suffice. Champagne and dessert... magical combination.  They rotate the desserts (please bring back that rhubarb ice cream thing!) so you can wear your big boy pants with a nice Cab or Malbec, and enjoy some milk and cookies for dessert like you know you want to.  Impeccable service, great advice from both the bartender and the manager.

ksRHD3gWsQGuK_r9GT-xKQ.review_text: I liked noir lounge. Went there to work (I know work, right?). But really, went there to work and get a drink and it was great. Lots of comfy cool places to sit, dark mysterious atmosphere, noir movies playing in the background and a cool playlist of mellow jazz.   Internet is free and fast (15mbps!). Lots of outlets. And tasty drinks.  If you come here during their happy hour you can get the giantest glass of wine for only $7! It was unbelievable. Took me 3 hours to finish drinking it.   I will most definitely come back here again, if i need to get some work done or just to hang out maybe. I hear this place is a piano bar too.  Overall great experience. Fun cool spot. And not crowded or loud which is hard to believe especially in this neighborhood. Perhaps it's due to the size of this bar. It's huge. So it can feel intimate and spacious at the same time thanks to the adorable little nooks and booths and furnitured romantic corners.  Good for dates.

MxaaFrjsn3TWPbHhPey29g.review_text: Husband and I decided to leave after being ignored for 20 minutes.  We gave up after flagging down our server twice, once for menus and again to order.  Started to take it personally after we saw her spend several minutes with other tables.  Cant rate the food because we couldn't get service!   I thought about finding a manager to complain to; but thought better of it because I didnt want to ruin the evening waiting for them too!  Won't be returning.

tJNADammQ_Ia6xqKAbQgtw.review_text: The ambiance is cozy and laid back, but I was a little bit confused on the venue.    My friend said to meet at Noir Lounge, which I knew as Lunchpad.  Based on my experience I'm guessing the bar is known as Noir Lounge, and the kitchen as Lunchpad.  Service is generally friendly.  I've been twice and had a decent fried chicken lunch sandwich with a side of fresh Parmesan potato chips.  The second time I came I ordered a Pilsner and side order of potato chips (only $2-a delicious deal). You order food and drinks at the bar.  I asked to pay with cash, but the beer had to be on a separate tab and paying alcoholic beverage with a credit card is required due to technical equipment.  A little inconvenient to pay separate tabs for food and alcohol, perhaps they can work on making the check payment more seamless for the customer.

Z0u6nxfaHYeqdUnH_FnDiQ.review_text: This place is ok. Good premise/theme for a wine bar with the black and white movies and all, but the service/experience is spotty.  1st visit - GREAT service. Super nice, personable server. Great suggestion for a moderately-priced bottle of wine. There was a weird bar/mildew smell in the back room where we were sitting though. This was during happy hour in the middle of the week.  2nd visit - we arrived at 9:30 on a Tuesday night. We weren't aware they closed at 10. We ordered a moderately-priced bottle of syrah, which they were out of. All good. We asked for a suggestion. She suggests another moderately-priced bottle and a nicer bottle. We order the nicer bottle. She brings the bottle back, opens it, then announces they will be closing in 20 minutes. GREAT. We just ordered a $60 bottle of wine and we have 20 minutes to suck it down. We would have just ordered glasses if we knew they were closing that soon. The server should have mentioned that BEFORE opening the bottle!  Whatevs. We probably won't be back. Peace.

J_1PrYg2sBg1lhAQnec40g.review_text: First time here tonight. Had a great time. Our waitress Katie is very friendly,  knowledgable and personal. She made good recommendations on wines based on my pallet. Thank you! Definitely coming back!

awmRirDC7WWig6R07XZ_oA.review_text: LOVE at first sight, I feel like I'm in a library of my dreams (though there are no books) - I love love love the salad dressing for the salad that accompanies the steak and chase.

DrxGlDObuKcMb5y7OUJBWQ.review_text: It's always tough to review a place too early.  I think a rule of thumb should be that if you're checking it out in its first two months of being open - let alone the "soft open" phase - that you need to go easy on service criticism and focus on the material: food, drink, decor.  I'll break my own rule and talk briefly about service.  I went the past two Thursdays to Noir Lounge to meet friends in Hayes Valley for happy hour.  First Thursday, service was a little rough as was to be expected - I didn't have a problem with that.  Second Thursday - the service (with the same servers working) was vastly improved.  That's what you should hope for - to see improvement.  The second Thursday, they totally took care of us like I'd expect from a place that's in its prime.  I think the staff and management are well on their way to having this place running smoothly.  As for the material: food, drink, decor - they're great.  The place is very nicely done inside.  It's rare to totally overhaul a space as they did and have it feel comfortable.  These guys pulled it off.  The food so far has been excellent and should evolve - I read in the press release they lost their chef right before opening, so I bet this will only get better.  Drink menu - on both the wine and beer side - is well thought out with lots of options for different tastes.  I'm happy with pricing and also think the big screen is a plus for sports watching - will definitely catch a game here at some point.  I'll be coming back pretty regularly I think.  Definitely give this place a shot.

fyTNJNGgCgn2fH3Tvr-YaQ.review_text: Great ambience and location!  Food menu is ok...what I have ordered has always been amazing.  The fried chicken is wicked good!  The staff including manager needs a redip in basic expectations of restaurant customer experience ASAP.  I do not how many times I have had to go to the bar myself for my drink refill.  When you ask for something, it is almost like you are bothering them. When they ask how things are going, they do not make eye contact - not genuine interaction what so ever.  I have also observed them leaving a table, and the facial expression confirms it all.    Overall, I really hope this place stays.  Owners need to be present to ensure customer experience and expectations are being met.  Cheers!

vRhya8Ig7llSdrvWrSuovw.review_text: The wine and food at this place both amazing.   The service is bad bad bad. They are incredibly snobby.  My partner and I used to like coming here while we wait for our table at Domo because we like a good glass of wine, but everytime we struggle to get the attention of the waiters. Finally, when we ask for what we would like to drink or munch on, the drinks take a long time. Come on it's just a glass of wine, should take 15 minutes to come to the table. Then the struggle to pay is another challenge.   Last time we decided to wait and order at the bar rather than sitting at a table, when we walked in and stood in front of the bar the bar tender told us that we could sit down anywhere in the place and a server would come (all the stools at the bar where taken). We smiled and told him we would rather order at the bar. He completely ignored us. We stood there for 10 minutes, no service, no engagement, nothing.   We decided to walk out and go to Two Sisters instead where service is way better and less snobby.   Will we come back? My man and I probably no. My girlfriends and I probably, but very probably.

9d9kgq7womnxi_NGKsJMEA.review_text: Noir Lounge is pretty good for what it is. They have a descent amount of wines available by the glass and a much larger selection available by the bottle. The beer list is not bad all things considered and the bar towards the back has rotating craft beers on tap.  The decor is dark and dimly lit and a bit on the fancier side, definitely not the scene for dive bar goers. The room in the back is pretty cool and has a large projection screen playing classic films which is a nice touch. The service when I came was acceptable but nothing to rate them well for.  The biggest downside here is the food, which was just bad. Their attempt of a modified "grilled cheese" was disgusting and was not grilled nor very cheesy. My wife and I played rock-paper-scissors and the loser had to finish off the sandwich as punishment (we don't waste food, even bad food). The meatballs were okay but a bit underwhelming and not worth the price. The only thing enjoyable to eat that we had were the potato tots, but they were also priced higher than they were worth.  Summary: Not a bad place to start off a night but that is it. Come here for a drink before heading somewhere else (some great restaurants in the area, and other watering holes have been popping up lately). Don't plan on staying long and definitely do not plan on eating here.

3sUh2Ok0GrAbO3Hd9f8csQ.review_text: $12 for a mediocre glass of wine is annoying.  Food was cold, even happy hour wasn't a good deal. Not impressed.

P1aS3PSrUqze_fpjAhHxSA.review_text: This is a beautifully designed bar with a film noir theme. Worth going to check that out alone. Very good beer & wine selection, and the food was excellent. Sounds like they just got a new chef who completely revamped the menu...not just small plates anymore. We had apps, salads, and entrees, all of which were delicious (Can't stop thinking about the poutine!). I see some past reviews had an issue with the food quality/portion size. If that's the case, go back, and try the new menu.

gzpBM2cLAojp8McEj4cx-A.review_text: If you have a waitress actually come to you, you can order some of the overly expensive and not filling food.  The food really isn't worth it.  The wine selection is okay but once again, you have to hope the waitress will come to you to actually order. Or you can sit at the bar.  But this is supposed to be a lounge-feeling bar...Good luck ordering a 2nd glass if you liked the first class.  There are much better options in Hayes Valley for a drink and food!

c8FOqDRhtL7q_YsQio6bog.review_text: I was lucky enough to be invited to a media reception for Noir Lounge - the sexy, new wine bar in Hayes Valley.  I really dug the vibe in this place. It's both modern and retro. The interior reminded me a little bit of the old Ambassador on Geary (kind of retro-chic). They have two bars for your wine/beer needs; a long communal table, and a V.I.P. room where they play classic films like "Maltese Falcon" on the wall while you sip the night away.   As part of the media event, we were treated to some bubbly and bites. Chef Joanna Karlinsky (formerly of Meetinghouse, Elite Cafe, and Sweet Jo's Cafe) has created an eclectic menu of gourmet movie theater snacks and shared plates to pair with your vino (everything from Swedish meatballs, deviled eggs, to Joanna's famous Meetinghouse Biscuits). There were also some tempting desserts floating around the room, but we left before I could try them.  In any case, I was definitely impressed with Noir Lounge. It's a wonderful, sophisticated addition to Hayes Street. I'm looking forward to returning here soon (preferably with a date), a pin-striped suit, and my fedora hat.  Somewhere out there, Humphrey Bogart is smiling.

l0ohqVeCYBC6Idb-bF8dRw.review_text: I attended the soft opening at Noir Lounge the other night and I was very impressed by the quality of the food and wine! The atmosphere they've created with the space has a unique feel to it. A film lounge? Sign me up! Our server, Olivia, was also very attentive and made the entire night an enjoyable experience. I can easily see this place becoming my go-to spot for drinks with friends in Hayes Valley.

d4_dSGZ-Rqeo8c1PgsjtiA.review_text: I feel shocked and saddened after reading a fellow Yelper's 1 star review. What makes me even more sad is that he appears to have been invited through friends of friend to the Happy Hour I helped organize at Noir Lounge last week (we go try new bars a couple of times a month).  Well let me tell you, Noir Lounge is AWESOME. Unlike this yelper who sounds like a whiny as$hole, I thought this place was great, along with the 20 or so other friends who joined us. Everyone seemed to highly enjoy the venue and the service was great.   I too, happen to travel all around the world and I can't even begin to understand this dude's comments about how this compares to the bottom 10% of the world. This dude is a wannabee critic and obviously knows nothing about anything he is talking about.   I ordered my drinks through the cocktail waitresses who were genuinely friendly (much more than what I am used to in the city's establishments) and delivered my drinks quickly. The manager and owner of the bar came to me multiple time to check how we were doing and seemed completely sincere.  They are really trying hard to make this place a great venue in Hayes Valley and I admire their effort.  As a new venue, there may be some small issues here and there at some points in time, but that should be expected from any new place (I personally didn't notice anything negative). Instead of smashing new business' reputation on Yelp and act likes entitled asses, people should  learn to support local businesses.   Noir Lounge, thank you for believing in Hayes Valley, you have our support!

sZsurHFiUbGQr3FB8sS27A.review_text: Considering myself decently qualified to assess wine bars (I run/work in a few) this bar is stellar. The staff is so friendly; I was lucky enough to be taken care of by Jessica. The environment is quite breathtaking. I am such a sucker for deep, neutral colors and classic decor and this bar has it down.   During my time here, they got a decent amount of tables at the same time and my experience did not waiver. I will definitely be returning and encouraging others to.

VEOD6Y-w1UoRnxzJZjTI1g.review_text: This is exactly what you would expect of a Noir Lounge.  It is dark inside with rich sultry finishings and furniture.  A film noir, not surprisingly, plays on a wall.   Drinks are decent and some of the bar snacks are worth eating but many are fried or greasy.  The crowd is cool and eclectic.

5hCRkGLTSf8ax3Ck14WPiA.review_text: Terrible service, good wine. I can handle the bad attitude, but the waiting time was unbelievably long... and they only had one other party of people there!

DlwexC7z88ymAzu45skODw.review_text: Pricey, but good.  I came here with a couple friends for an early dinner on a Saturday night. It's a pretty new place so I wanted to check out what happened to the old Fritjzszs. The atmosphere's great- much bigger than it appears upon first glance, as it goes really far back in the building and has a lot of cool nooks. I particularly like the second bar area in the back. And the decor's great too.  The food was quite good, the chicken and waffles really stood out- juicy crispy fried chicken and fluffy waffles, paired with a duo of creamy gravy and a decadent maple sauce, and topped with candied pecans. Stellar. The poutine appetizer was also delicious.   So- overall a good place for a drink or snacks, just be prepared for the bill... Things add up quick!
